title: Access to arbitrary file of the Nextcloud Android app from within the Nextcloud Android app

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

To give it a try, please install the attached poc.apk file on your mobile device.
{F1524007}
@lukasreschkenc Any update on this report? Thanks.
Apologies for the delay here, I've filed a ticket for the product team and will let you know once I receive an update.

Good morning @lukasreschkenc,

It has been one month so I'm wondering whether you have an update or whether I can provide more help. Would you please provide an update when you have a chance?

Thanks,
@luchua

A fix is in progress here:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/9645

Feel free to test the modified version and report back if it is fixing the issue for you.

Thanks @nickvergessen a lot for the prompt update. I've cloned the repository, downloaded the modified version, compiled a test APK, then tested on my Android phone and confirmed the fix does address the issue.

Please close the report as resolved.

Thanks,
@luchua
Currently waiting for the client team to merge the PR and do a release. I will poke them again
Hi @nickvergessen, please let me know when there is an update. Thanks.

Hi @nickvergessen,

As the issue has been fixed in a new build over 3 months before, I'm wondering whether the report can move to the next phase of issuing bounty. Please advise.

Thanks,
@luchua
I will check again with the team about the progress. I think it should be included in the upcoming release and we will then also assign the bounty.
Thank @nickvergessen for the update.

Good afternoon @nickvergessen,

It has been another 3 months since I requested an update last time. Now my report is 2 months over the average time to bounty (6 months).

Is there any chance that this report can be moved to the phase of bounty payment? And is it possible for the fix to be integrated into the next coming release?

Thanks,
@luchua

Sorry, I forgot to forward a message here.

The team created a PR here: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/10544
It contains a link to the APK. Can you test and confirm the fix?

Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

If you have a GitHub account please let us know the username, and we will associate it with the advisory.

Hi @nickvergessen,

Thanks for the update. My GitHub account is `luchua-bc` (`https://github.com/luchua-bc`).

Thanks,
@luchua

May I ask when the bounty will be awarded? Also I noticed I didn't receive points for resolving the issue (typically a medium severity is 15 or 25). And what's the maintenance release number with the fix? Please advise. Thanks.

Hi @nickvergessen,

Please answer my questions below:
1. Will a bounty will awarded? And what's the reason if not.
2. What's the advisory number created
3. The release number with the fix so that I can know where/when my reported vulnerability was addressed.

Thanks,
@luchua

Hi @nickvergessen,

Any update? 

As a researcher who contributed to your program, I think I deserve at least a response.

Thanks,
@luchua

Sorry in germany it's currently vacation season so the answer was delayed.

We just fixed the issue on a release on 8th August. So the security advisory will be published in the week of 5th September (and we usually publish on Thursdays, so that's the 8th September).

The CVE is assigned during the process by GitHub and we will add the CVE ID to the Hackerone ticket after GitHub assigned it, which should happen later this week.

A bounty is likely but the person approving bounties is on vacation this week so that might take until later next week as it's also not the first thing we do after returning from longer vacation breaks.

Thank @nickvergessen for the update. Very much appreciated. 

I'm looking forward to having the report closed later next week.

Have a nice day!

@luchua

additional_data.old_title: Leak arbitrary file from the nextcloud android client
additional_data.new_title: Access to arbitrary file of the Nextcloud Android app from within the Nextcloud Android app

activities.message: Security advisory draft is at https://github.com/nextcloud/security-advisories/security/advisories/GHSA-vw2w-gpcv-v39f
Thank @nickvergessen for creating the security advisory draft and the bounty.
I've reviewed and accepted the security advisory draft in GitHub. Is the report deemed as public disclosure now or will it be disclosed later following a different process? Please advise. Thanks.
Should be published tomorrow or after my short vacation on 12th september

Thank @nickvergessen for the update. Also in my opinion, Confidentiality of the CVSS score shall be set to High because arbitrary configuration/protected file of the mobile app can be leaked. However, I'm fine with the program assessment.
And it's fine with me for the program to disclose the complete discussion thread, or selected parts, or only limited information.
